description_header: If you are not currently participating with Anthem but wish to be, read and follow the instructions below to apply.
footer: Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield is the trade name of: In Indiana: Anthem Insurance Companies, Inc. In Kentucky: Anthem Health Plans of Kentucky, Inc. In Missouri (excluding 30 counties in the Kansas City area): RightCHOICE® Managed Care, Inc. (RIT), Healthy Alliance® Life Insurance Company (HALIC), and HMO Missouri, Inc. RIT and certain affiliates administer non-HMO benefits underwritten by HALIC and HMO benefits underwritten by HMO Missouri, Inc. RIT and certain affiliates only provide administrative services for self-funded plans and do not underwrite benefits. In Ohio: Community Insurance Company. In Wisconsin: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Wisconsin (BCBSWI), underwrites or administers PPO and indemnity policies and underwrites the out of network benefits in POS policies offered by Compcare Health Services Insurance Corporation (Compcare) or Wisconsin Collaborative Insurance Company (WCIC). Compcare underwrites or administers HMO or POS policies; WCIC underwrites or administers Well Priority HMO or POS policies. Independent licensees of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association. ANTHEM is a registered trademark of Anthem Insurance Companies, Inc.

blocks.body: If you wish to become a contracted provider or add a provider to your existing group, submit an application by going to the digital provider enrollment application for Anthem hosted on www.availity.com.

If your organization is not currently registered with Availity, the person(s) designated as your administrator(s) should go to www.availity.com and select register in the upper right-hand corner of the webpage in order to obtain an Availity account. You may also navigate directly to Availity’s registration website by clicking here: Availity Registration.

If you are not currently designated as an administrator on www.availity.com but are already a registered user, go to My Account Dashboard > My Account > Organization(s) > Administrator Information to determine who your organization’s administrators are. Your administrator will need to add Provider Enrollment to your Availity profile in order for you to access the digital provider enrollment application for Anthem in Payer Spaces.
Once you log into www.availity.com, select Payer Spaces > Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield > Applications > Provider Enrollment to begin the application process.
Log onto www.availity.com/Contact-Us or call Availity Client Services at 800-AVAILITY (800-282-4548).

All of the information provided in the digital provider enrollment application for Anthem will be used to determine contract eligibility. You will receive an application ID upon successful submission. Use this application ID if you need to contact Anthem for the status of your application which you can do by navigating to the Contact Us page at www.anthem.com/provider/contact-us.

blocks: Were you aware that making changes to your demographic information is about to become a whole lot easier? Beginning on 07/01/2023, a majority of providers contracted with Anthem Blue Cross and Blue Shield (Anthem) will have the ability to begin utilizing Availity’s Provider Demographic Management (PDM) service hosted on www.availity.com. Availity PDM is used to request changes to existing practice information related to your Anthem contracted physicians, practitioners, professionals, and ancillary providers. See the section titled Availity Registration or click here.
Until the aforementioned migration date, you may continue submitting your changes through this Provider Maintenance Form (PMF).
Note: The PMF is best viewed when using Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge.
